level-up.name: ember
level-up.description:
The target is attacked with small flames. This may
also leave the target with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

level-up.name: tail-whip
level-up.description:
The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing
Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: stomp
level-up.description:
The target is stomped with a big foot. This may also
make the target flinch.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Power is doubled against Pokémon that have used minimize since entering the field.

level-up.name: growl
level-up.description:
The user growls in an endearing way, making
opposing Pokémon less wary. This lowers their
Attack stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

level-up.name: fire-spin
level-up.description:
The target becomes trapped within a fierce vortex
of fire that rages for four to five turns.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid spin cancels this effect.

level-up.name: take-down
level-up.description:
A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into
the target. This also damages the user a little.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

level-up.name: agility
level-up.description:
The user relaxes and lightens its body to move
faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: horn-drill
machine.description:
The user stabs the target with a horn that rotates
like a drill. The target faints instantly if this
attack hits.
machine.effect:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock on, mind reader, and no guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.

machine.name: body-slam
machine.description:
The user drops onto the target with its full body
weight. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

machine.name: take-down
machine.description:
A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into
the target. This also damages the user a little.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: double-edge
machine.description:
A reckless, life-risking tackle in which the user rushes
the target. This also damages the user quite a lot.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: rage
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

machine.name: mimic
machine.description:
The user copies the target’s last move. The move
can be used during battle until the Pokémon is
switched out.
machine.effect:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: reflect
machine.description:
A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage
from physical attacks for five turns.
machine.effect:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from physical attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hits are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: bide
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: fire-blast
machine.description:
The target is attacked with an intense blast of
all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target
with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: swift
machine.description:
Star-shaped rays are shot at opposing Pokémon.
This attack never misses.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: skull-bash
machine.description:
The user tucks in its head to raise its Defense
stat on the first turn, then rams the target on the
next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Defense by one stage.  User then charges for one turn before attacking.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: double-kick
egg.description:
The target is quickly kicked twice in succession
using both feet.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Hits twice in one turn.

egg.name: thrash
egg.description:
The user rampages and attacks for two to three
turns. The user then becomes confused.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

egg.name: hypnosis
egg.description:
The user employs hypnotic suggestion to make the
target fall into a deep sleep.
egg.effect: Puts the target to sleep.

egg.name: quick-attack
egg.description:
The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes
it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: flame-wheel
egg.description:
The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the
target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

egg.name: charm
egg.description:
The user gazes at the target rather charmingly,
making it less wary. This harshly lowers the target’s
Attack stat.
egg.effect: Lowers the target's Attack by two stages.

tutor.name: flamethrower
tutor.description:
The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire.
This may also leave the target with a burn.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: headbutt
machine.description:
The user sticks out its head and attacks by charging
straight into the target. This may also make the
target flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: curse
machine.description:
A move that works differently for the Ghost type
than for all other types.
machine.effect:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: snore
machine.description:
This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.
The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
machine.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: endure
machine.description:
The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
machine.effect:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: iron-tail
machine.description:
The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

tutor.name: snore
tutor.description:
This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.
The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
tutor.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: endure
tutor.description:
The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
tutor.effect:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: swagger
tutor.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
tutor.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

tutor.name: sleep-talk
tutor.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
tutor.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: strength
machine.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown at
maximum power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: solar-beam
machine.description:
In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then
blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: iron-tail
machine.description:
The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: flamethrower
machine.description:
The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire.
This may also leave the target with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: fire-blast
machine.description:
The target is attacked with an intense blast of
all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target
with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: secret-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyzes target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage

Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: overheat
machine.description:
The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s
recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.

level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: growl
level-up.description:
The user growls in an endearing way, making
opposing Pokémon less wary. This lowers their
Attack stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

level-up.name: tail-whip
level-up.description:
The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing
Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: ember
level-up.description:
The target is attacked with small flames. This may
also leave the target with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

level-up.name: flame-wheel
level-up.description:
The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the
target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

level-up.name: stomp
level-up.description:
The target is stomped with a big foot. This may also
make the target flinch.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Power is doubled against Pokémon that have used minimize since entering the field.

level-up.name: fire-spin
level-up.description:
The target becomes trapped within a fierce vortex
of fire that rages for four to five turns.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid spin cancels this effect.

level-up.name: take-down
level-up.description:
A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into
the target. This also damages the user a little.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

level-up.name: agility
level-up.description:
The user relaxes and lightens its body to move
faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

level-up.name: fire-blast
level-up.description:
The target is attacked with an intense blast of
all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target
with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

level-up.name: bounce
level-up.description:
The user bounces up high, then drops on the target
on the second turn. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User bounces high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky uppercut, smack down, thunder, and twister still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

level-up.name: flare-blitz
level-up.description:
The user cloaks itself in fire and charges the target.
This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack
may leave the target with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

egg.name: double-kick
egg.description:
The target is quickly kicked twice in succession
using both feet.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Hits twice in one turn.

egg.name: horn-drill
egg.description:
The user stabs the target with a horn that rotates
like a drill. The target faints instantly if this
attack hits.
egg.effect:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock on, mind reader, and no guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.

egg.name: thrash
egg.description:
The user rampages and attacks for two to three
turns. The user then becomes confused.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

egg.name: double-edge
egg.description:
A reckless, life-risking tackle in which the user rushes
the target. This also damages the user quite a lot.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: hypnosis
egg.description:
The user employs hypnotic suggestion to make the
target fall into a deep sleep.
egg.effect: Puts the target to sleep.

egg.name: flame-wheel
egg.description:
The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the
target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

egg.name: charm
egg.description:
The user gazes at the target rather charmingly,
making it less wary. This harshly lowers the target’s
Attack stat.
egg.effect: Lowers the target's Attack by two stages.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: natural-gift
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: growl
level-up.description:
The user growls in an endearing way, making
opposing Pokémon less wary. This lowers their
Attack stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

level-up.name: tail-whip
level-up.description:
The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing
Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: ember
level-up.description:
The target is attacked with small flames. This may
also leave the target with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

level-up.name: flame-wheel
level-up.description:
The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the
target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

level-up.name: stomp
level-up.description:
The target is stomped with a big foot. This may also
make the target flinch.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Power is doubled against Pokémon that have used minimize since entering the field.

level-up.name: flame-charge
level-up.description:
Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks the target.
Then, building up more power, the user raises its
Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Speed by one stage.

level-up.name: fire-spin
level-up.description:
The target becomes trapped within a fierce vortex
of fire that rages for four to five turns.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid spin cancels this effect.

level-up.name: take-down
level-up.description:
A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into
the target. This also damages the user a little.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

level-up.name: inferno
level-up.description:
The user attacks by engulfing the target in an
intense fire. This leaves the target with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to burn the target.

level-up.name: agility
level-up.description:
The user relaxes and lightens its body to move
faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

level-up.name: fire-blast
level-up.description:
The target is attacked with an intense blast of
all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target
with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

level-up.name: bounce
level-up.description:
The user bounces up high, then drops on the target
on the second turn. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User bounces high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky uppercut, smack down, thunder, and twister still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

level-up.name: flare-blitz
level-up.description:
The user cloaks itself in fire and charges the target.
This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack
may leave the target with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

egg.name: double-kick
egg.description:
The target is quickly kicked twice in succession
using both feet.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Hits twice in one turn.

egg.name: horn-drill
egg.description:
The user stabs the target with a horn that rotates
like a drill. The target faints instantly if this
attack hits.
egg.effect:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock on, mind reader, and no guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.

egg.name: thrash
egg.description:
The user rampages and attacks for two to three
turns. The user then becomes confused.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

egg.name: double-edge
egg.description:
A reckless, life-risking tackle in which the user rushes
the target. This also damages the user quite a lot.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: low-kick
egg.description:
A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over.
The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

egg.name: hypnosis
egg.description:
The user employs hypnotic suggestion to make the
target fall into a deep sleep.
egg.effect: Puts the target to sleep.

egg.name: flame-wheel
egg.description:
The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the
target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

egg.name: charm
egg.description:
The user gazes at the target rather charmingly,
making it less wary. This harshly lowers the target’s
Attack stat.
egg.effect: Lowers the target's Attack by two stages.

egg.name: morning-sun
egg.description:
The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP
regained varies with the weather.
egg.effect:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.

egg.name: captivate
egg.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
egg.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

tutor.description:
This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.
The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
tutor.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: sleep-talk
tutor.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
tutor.effect:

The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail.

tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

Pokémon. This may also leave those Pokémon with
a burn.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: strength
machine.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown at
maximum power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: solar-beam
machine.description:
In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then
blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: flamethrower
machine.description:
The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire.
This may also leave the target with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: fire-blast
machine.description:
The target is attacked with an intense blast of
all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target
with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: flame-charge
machine.description:
Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks the target.
Then, building up more power, the user raises its
Speed stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: echoed-voice
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with an echoing voice.
If this move is used every turn, its power
is increased.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If any friendly Pokémon used this move earlier this turn or on the previous turn, that use's power is added to this move's power, to a maximum of 200.

machine.name: overheat
machine.description:
The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s
recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.

machine.name: incinerate
machine.description:
The user attacks opposing Pokémon with fire.
If a Pokémon is holding a certain item, such as a
Berry, the item becomes burned up and unusable.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, it's destroyed and cannot be used in response to this move.

machine.name: will-o-wisp
machine.description:
The user shoots a sinister flame at the target to inflict
a burn.
machine.effect: Burns the target.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky uppercut, smack down, thunder, and twister still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

level-up.name: flare-blitz
level-up.description:
The user cloaks itself in fire and charges the target.
This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack
may leave the target with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

egg.name: double-kick
egg.description:
The target is quickly kicked twice in succession
using both feet.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Hits twice in one turn.

egg.name: horn-drill
egg.description:
The user stabs the target with a horn that rotates
like a drill. The target faints instantly if this
attack hits.
egg.effect:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock on, mind reader, and no guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.

egg.name: thrash
egg.description:
The user rampages and attacks for two to three
turns. The user then becomes confused.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

egg.name: double-edge
egg.description:
A reckless, life-risking tackle in which the user rushes
the target. This also damages the user quite a lot.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: low-kick
egg.description:
A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over.
The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

egg.name: hypnosis
egg.description:
The user employs hypnotic suggestion to make the
target fall into a deep sleep.
egg.effect: Puts the target to sleep.

egg.name: flame-wheel
egg.description:
The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the
target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

egg.name: charm
egg.description:
The user gazes at the target rather charmingly,
making it less wary. This harshly lowers the target’s
Attack stat.
egg.effect: Lowers the target's Attack by two stages.

egg.name: morning-sun
egg.description:
The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP
regained varies with the weather.
egg.effect:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.

egg.name: captivate
egg.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
egg.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

egg.name: ally-switch
egg.description:
The user teleports using a strange power and
switches places with one of its allies.
egg.effect: User switches position on the field with the friendly Pokémon opposite it.  If the user is in the middle position in a triple battle, or there are no other friendly Pokémon, this move will fail.

machine.name: strength
machine.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown at
maximum power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: solar-beam
machine.description:
In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then
blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: flamethrower
machine.description:
The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire.
This may also leave the target with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: fire-blast
machine.description:
The target is attacked with an intense blast of
all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target
with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: flame-charge
machine.description:
Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks the target.
Then, building up more power, the user raises its
Speed stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: echoed-voice
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with an echoing voice.
If this move is used every turn, its power
is increased.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If any friendly Pokémon used this move earlier this turn or on the previous turn, that use's power is added to this move's power, to a maximum of 200.

machine.name: overheat
machine.description:
The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s
recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.

machine.name: incinerate
machine.description:
The user attacks opposing Pokémon with fire.
If a Pokémon is holding a certain item, such as a
Berry, the item becomes burned up and unusable.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, it's destroyed and cannot be used in response to this move.

machine.name: will-o-wisp
machine.description:
The user shoots a sinister flame at the target to inflict
a burn.
machine.effect: Burns the target.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: wild-charge
machine.description:
The user shrouds itself in electricity and smashes
into its target. This also damages the user a little.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: confide
machine.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and the target
loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: growl

opposing Pokémon less wary. This lowers their

level-up.name: agility

The user relaxes and lightens its body to move
faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.
